H0.text: What term is used when a clot forms in a blood vessel. Thrombus

H1.text: What term is used when a clot forms in a blood vessel. Embolism

H2.text: What term is used when a clot forms in a blood vessel. Coagulopathy

H3.text: What term is used when a clot forms in a blood vessel. Trombosis

A4.text: A thrombus (pl. thrombi) is a solid or semisolid aggregate from constituents of the blood (platelets, fibrin, red blood cells, white blood cells) within the circulatory system during life.

A5.text: If an embolus becomes trapped within a blood vessel, it blocks blood flow and is termed as an embolism.
